statement_context: an interview with Fox's Tucker Carlson
ruling_headline: Donald Trump says he learned Obama tapped his phones from the New York Times
statement: Says "the New York Times wrote about" Barack Obama wiretapping Donald Trump during the election.

ruling_headline: Gutierrez says 'hundreds of Republican amendments' were a part of Obamacare
statement: "2009-2010, let's remember, hundreds of Republican amendments were adopted in the ACA."

ruling_headline: Mick Mulvaney's misleading claim that House GOP health care plan keeps Medicaid expansion
statement: The House Republican health care "plan doesn't get rid of Medicaid expansion."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump trumpets 40 percent decrease in illegal border crossings. Is he right?
statement: "In the first full month of my administration following the issuance of my executive orders, illegal immigration on our southern border fell by an unprecedented 40 percent."

ruling_headline: Are Mexican drug cartels working with 100,000 street gang members in Chicago?
statement: "According to the FBI, Mexican drug cartels are working with 100,000 street gang members in Chicago alone."

statement_context: a listening session on health care
ruling_headline: Donald Trump: One-third of counties have only one insurer on Affordable Care Act exchanges
statement: "One-third of the counties — think of it, one-third — only have one insurer left" on the Affordable Care Act exchanges.

ruling_headline: Tom Price undercounts Obamacare impact on getting more Americans insured
statement: "The number of individuals who actually got coverage through the exchange who didn't have coverage before, or who weren't eligible for Medicaid before is relatively small. So we've turned things upside down completely for 3 million, or 4 million, or 5 million individuals."

ruling_headline: Fact-checking White House criticism of CBO health care analysis
statement: "If the CBO was right about Obamacare to begin with, there'd be 8 million more people on Obamacare today than there actually are. … Sometimes we ask them to do stuff that they're not capable of doing."

ruling_headline: HHS chief Tom Price mostly correct that ER use is up since Obamacare
statement: The Obama administration said "they were going to be able to drive folks away from one of the most expensive areas for the provision of health care, and that is the emergency rooms. In fact, they did just the opposite."

ruling_headline: EPA head Scott Pruitt says carbon dioxide is not 'primary contributor' to global warming
statement: Carbon dioxide is not "a primary contributor to the global warming that we see."

statement_context: an interview on MSNBC's "All In With Chis Hayes"
ruling_headline: Sanders: GOP health care plan gives wealthiest a $275 billion tax break
statement: The GOP health care plan gives "$275 billion in tax breaks for the top 2 percent, people earning $250,000 a year or more."

ruling_headline: Are Americans gaming the system to get cheaper Obamacare coverage?
statement: Under the Affordable Care Act, "some people were gaming the system" by paying "for nine months of insurance, get 12 -- the other three for free."

statement_context: an interview with CNN's "State of the Union"
ruling_headline: Nancy Pelosi says Donald Trump's child-care proposal mainly benefits high earners
statement: Says 70 percent of benefits in Donald Trump’s proposal for child care "go to the people making over $100,000 a year."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump wrongly blames Barack Obama for former Guantanamo detainees returning to terrorism
statement: "122 vicious prisoners, released by the Obama Administration from Gitmo, have returned to the battlefield."

ruling_headline: Why the White House defense of Trump wiretap accusation is misleading
statement: "Everybody acts like President Trump is the one that came up with this idea. ... There are multiple news outlets that have reported" former President Barack Obama ordered wiretapping on Trump.

ruling_headline: Rand Paul said repealing 3 regulations saves millions of dollars, thousands of jobs
statement: "We've repealed regulations for the first time in 20 years using the Congressional Review Act -- three regulations that were going to cost the economy hundreds of millions of dollars and tens of thousands of jobs."

ruling_headline: Claire McCaskill says she never met with Russian ambassador, past tweets say otherwise
statement: "I’ve been on the Armed Services (Committee) for 10 years. No call or meeting w/ Russian ambassador. Ever."

statement_context: a speech before a joint session of Congress
ruling_headline: Trump misleads in claim about terrorism convictions since 9/11
statement: "According to data provided by the Department of Justice, the vast majority of individuals convicted of terrorism and terrorism-related offenses since 9/11 came here from outside of our country."

ruling_headline: Trump exaggerates economic burden of export tariffs in speech to Congress
statement: "Currently, when we ship products out of America, many other countries make us pay very high tariffs and taxes — but when foreign companies ship their products into America, we charge them nothing or almost nothing."

ruling_headline: Taxes on wealthy pay for Obamacare? DNC's Perez overshoots
statement: "The primary financing mechanism of the Affordable Care Act is a tax on wealthy people."

ruling_headline: Trump wrongly claims historic defense increase
statement: Says his budget "calls for one of the largest increases in national defense spending in American history."

ruling_headline: Fact-checking Donald Trump’s claim about soaring Obamacare premiums
statement: "Obamacare premiums nationwide have increased by double and triple digits."

ruling_headline: No evidence that protesters are paid to disrupt Republican town hall meetings
statement: Political activists are "being paid" to protest members of Congress.

statement_context: an interview on NBC's "Meet the Press"
ruling_headline: Mostly False: New DNC chair Tom Perez says Donald Trump wants to eliminate overtime pay
statement: Says "Donald Trump wants to eliminate overtime pay for people."

ruling_headline: Why Donald Trump's tweet about national debt decrease in his first month is highly misleading
statement: "The National Debt in my first month went down by $12 billion."

ruling_headline: In Texas, do you have to drive 120 miles for a voter ID?
statement: "If you're in Texas, you have got to drive 120 miles to get an ID."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump in Florida laments 'what's happening last night in Sweden.' But nothing happened
statement: "Look at what’s happening last night in Sweden. Sweden, who would believe this? Sweden. They took in large numbers. They’re having problems like they never thought possible."

ruling_headline: Sen. Bob Menendez says immigration raids 'not business as usual'
statement: Recent immigration raids "are not business as usual. The raids are being done indiscriminately. They’re not focused simply on criminal aliens."

ruling_headline: Trump hints stock market record high linked to optimism about his presidency
statement: "The stock market has hit record numbers, as you know. And there has been a tremendous surge of optimism in the business world."

ruling_headline: Is news media less trusted than Congress?
statement: The media has "a lower approval rate than Congress."

statement_context: comments during and after the 2016 presidential campaign
ruling_headline: Trump's flip-flop on leaks and the release of secret information
statement: On leaks and the release of secret information.

statement_context: a joint press conference with President Donald Trump
ruling_headline: Benjamin Netanyahu largely correct on Iranian missiles with Hebrew-language threats
statement: In the "past few weeks," President Donald Trump pointed out "Iranian violations on ballistic missile tests. By the way, these ballistic missiles are inscribed in Hebrew, ‘Israel must be destroyed.’ "

statement_context: an interview with MSNBC's Chris Hayes
ruling_headline: West Virginia uninsured rate has declined, though not as fast as Bernie Sanders said
statement: "Before the Affordable Care Act, (West Virginia’s) uninsured rate for people 64 to 19 was 29 percent. Today, it is 9 percent."

ruling_headline: Did court find no indication of terrorism from seven nations in Trump order?
statement: "I'm calling into question the accuracy of the ruling. The district judge in Seattle said there was no indication of terrorism from these seven countries in our country."

ruling_headline: Arkansas senator says of 1 million green cards issued, few are employment-based
statement: Of 1 million green cards issued a year, "almost none of those green cards are based on job skills or demonstrated economic needs."

ruling_headline: Border fence in Israel cut illegal immigration by 99 percent, GOP senator says
statement: Israel cut its illegal immigration rate by "99 percent" by constructing a 143-mile fence along its southern border.

ruling_headline: Donald Trump says refugee admissions surged from 7 countries during suspension of executive order
statement: Says "72% of refugees admitted into U.S. (2/3 -2/11) during COURT BREAKDOWN are from 7 countries: SYRIA, IRAQ, SOMALIA, IRAN, SUDAN, LIBYA & YEMEN."

ruling_headline: White House senior adviser repeats baseless claim about busing illegal voters in New Hampshire
statement: "This issue of busing voters in to New Hampshire is widely known by anyone who’s worked in New Hampshire politics. It’s very real, it’s very serious."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump wrongly says CNN cut off Bernie Sanders for calling network 'fake news'
statement: "While on FAKE NEWS @CNN, Bernie Sanders was cut off for using the term fake news to describe the network. They said technical difficulties!"

ruling_headline: Sanders said Obama's SCOTUS nominees 'required' 60 votes, but it's more complicated
statement: Says former President Barack Obama’s Supreme Court nominations "required 60 votes."

ruling_headline: Trump wrong on  Sen. Blumenthal's CNN interview and Vietnam
statement: Says CNN’s Chris Cuomo "never asked" Sen. Richard Blumenthal about Blumenthal's misstatements on his own service in Vietnam.

ruling_headline: Senate Republicans did not use Rule 19 when Ted Cruz attacked Mitch McConnell
statement: "Back when Ted Cruz called Mitch McConnell a liar on the floor of the Senate floor, nobody invoked Rule 19 to censor him."

statement_context: a meeting with sheriffs in the White House
ruling_headline: Donald Trump wrong that murder rate is highest in 47 years
statement: "The murder rate in our country is the highest it’s been in 47 years."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump wrong to say Kuwait followed his lead on visa ban
statement: "Smart! 'Kuwait issues its own Trump-esque visa ban for five Muslim-majority countries.' "

ruling_headline: No proof ISIS leaders using Donald Trump's travel ban for recruitment
statement: "ISIS is already using the rhetoric from the Trump administration, the text of this executive order, to incite attacks against us and to recruit more terrorists to their side."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump wrong that media is not reporting on terrorism any more
statement: Terrorism and terrorist attacks in the United States and Europe have "gotten to a point where it's not even being reported."

ruling_headline: President Trump says 109 people were affected by travel ban. It's at least 60,000
statement: Says "109 people out of hundreds of thousands of travelers" were affected by the immigration executive order.

ruling_headline: Fact-checking Kellyanne Conway on the 'Bowling Green massacre'
statement: "Two Iraqis came here to this country, were radicalized and they were the masterminds behind the Bowling Green massacre. … It didn't get covered"

ruling_headline: Kellyanne Conway wrongly says this is longest the U.S. has gone without a Treasury secretary
statement: "This is longest that the nation has gone without a secretary of the Treasury, at least in modern times. If it's not the longest, it's darn close to it."

ruling_headline: Most Syrian refugees are women and children, as Keith Ellison said
statement: "About three-quarters of (Syrian refugees) are women and children. A full third of them are kids under 12 years old."

ruling_headline: Trump claims Obama made deal to take thousands of illegal immigrants from Australia
statement: "The Obama Administration agreed to take thousands of illegal immigrants from Australia."

ruling_headline: Does Neil Gorsuch side with 'felons over gun safety,' as Pelosi says?
statement: Says Neil Gorsuch "comes down on the side of felons over gun safety."

ruling_headline: Nancy Pelosi overstates Wall Street refusal to support Democrats
statement: "Wall Street comes out en masse with its money against House Democrats every election."

ruling_headline: McCain says Taliban 'murdered' people because of Chelsea Manning and WikiLeaks
statement: "The Taliban went after and murdered" people identified in the Chelsea Manning leaks.

statement_context: a speech at the March for Life
ruling_headline: Joni Ernst on target describing '11th-hour' Obama rule affecting Planned Parenthood
statement: The Obama administration issued an "11th-hour rule that entrenches federal family planning funding for Planned Parenthood."

ruling_headline: Spicer's misleading claim that Trump's National Security Council is 'identical' to Bush's, Obama's
statement: The language that's part of the president's National Security Council memo "is identical to the language" used by President George W. Bush in 2001 and President Barack Obama in 2009.

ruling_headline: Kellyanne Conway incorrect that worker remittances to Mexico are 'No. 1' income flow
statement: "Here's the fact: The No. 1 source of income into Mexico are Mexicans working here and sending the money back."

ruling_headline: Why comparing Trump's and Obama's immigration restrictions is flawed
statement: "My policy is similar to what President Obama did in 2011 when he banned visas for refugees from Iraq for six months."

ruling_headline: No terrorist attacks post 9/11 by people from countries in Trump's travel ban?
statement: "The various people who have, in fact, committed terrorist acts in this country, from 9/11 on, none of them came from any of the seven countries that are the subject of the president's executive order."

ruling_headline: No evidence for Trump claim that it was 'impossible' for Syrian Christians to enter U.S.
statement: "If you were a Muslim, you could come in, if you were a Christian, it was impossible."

ruling_headline: Chuck Schumer wrongly tweets 'Tillerson won't divest from Exxon'
statement: Says Rex "Tillerson won't divest from Exxon."

statement_context: an interview with ABC News' David Muir
ruling_headline: Donald Trump's inaugural speech polled well, but not as well as predecessors'
statement: "A poll just came out on my inauguration speech. … People loved it. Loved and liked."

statement_context: remarks at Department of Homeland Security
ruling_headline: Donald Trump was not 'unanimously endorsed' by ICE, border patrol
statement: Says ICE and border patrol officers "unanimously endorsed me for president."

ruling_headline: Claire McCaskill overstates tax impacts of repealing Obamacare
statement: "Not one dime of the tax cut that they are going to enact with the repeal of Obamacare will go to people who make under $200,000."

statement_context: his State of the State address
ruling_headline: Here's what you need to know about California's climate change deal
statement: "One hundred and ninety-four countries signed the Paris Agreement to control greenhouse gases. Our own voluntary agreement to accomplish the same goal — the Under2  MOU — has 165 signatories, representing a billion people."

ruling_headline: Pants on Fire claim that George Soros money went to Women's March protesters
statement: Say George Soros's money "went straight into the (Women’s March) protesters’ pockets."

ruling_headline: Sean Spicer wrongly uses Pew study to bolster claim that non-citizens vote in large numbers
statement: "There's one (study) that came out of Pew in 2008 that showed 14 percent of people who voted were noncitizens."

ruling_headline: Sean Spicer's claim of a 'dramatic expansion in the federal workforce' is exaggerated
statement: There has been a "dramatic expansion of the federal workforce in recent years."

statement_context: a page on the White House website
ruling_headline: Donald Trump's stat on homicide increase in major cities is solid
statement: "In 2015, homicides increased by 17 percent in America’s 50 largest cities. That’s the largest increase in 25 years."

statement_context: a statement on the White House website
ruling_headline: White House website says D.C. homicides climbed 50 percent, but more recent data shows they fell
statement: "In our nation’s capital, killings have risen by 50 percent."

ruling_headline: Trump wrongly blames press for feud with intel community
statement: "The media ... sort of made it sound like I had a feud with the intelligence community."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump had biggest inaugural crowd ever? Metrics don't show it
statement: "That was the largest audience to witness an inauguration, period."

ruling_headline: Trump wrongly says U.S. has made others rich while our wealth has 'dissipated'
statement: "We've made other countries rich while the wealth ... of our country has dissipated over the horizon."

statement_context: a viral image on the Internet
ruling_headline: Viral image about Democratic senators and 'big pharma' is misleading
statement: Thirteen Democratic senators "voted against cheaper medicines" and took millions from "big pharma since 2011."

ruling_headline: Education nominee Betsy DeVos says a Wyoming school might need guns to stop grizzly bears
statement: "I would imagine that there's probably a gun in the school (in Wapiti, Wyo.) to protect from potential grizzlies."

statement_context: an interview with NBC's 'Meet the Press'
ruling_headline: John Lewis wrong on whether he skipped an inauguration before Donald Trump's
statement: The inauguration of Donald Trump "will be the first one that I miss since I've been in Congress."

ruling_headline: Rep. Luke Messer is correct, 2006 act allows the construction of a border wall
statement: "By funding the authorization that’s already happened a decade ago (in the Secure Fence Act of 2006), we could start the process of meeting Mr. Trump’s campaign pledge to secure the border."

ruling_headline: Trump's exaggerated claim that John Lewis' district is 'falling apart' and 'crime infested'
statement: Says Georgia’s 5th congressional district, represented by John Lewis, is "in horrible shape and falling apart (not to mention crime infested)."

statement_context: an interview on CNN's "State of the Union"
ruling_headline: Medicaid expansion drove health insurance coverage under health law, Rand Paul says
statement: "The vast majority of people that got insurance under President Obama's Obamacare, the Affordable Care Act, got it through Medicaid."

statement_context: a press conference at Trump Tower
ruling_headline: Trump lawyer: Foreign dignitaries staying in a Trump hotel doesn't violate Constitution
statement: "Paying for a hotel room is not a gift or a present and it has nothing to do with an office. It's not an emolument."

ruling_headline: Keith Ellison wrong that CBO can't analyze cost of Obamacare repeal
statement: "House GOP rules package bars CBO from counting spikes in deficit spending spurred by an ACA repeal."

ruling_headline: Rex Tillerson misleads on Russian sanctions opposition
statement: "I have never lobbied against sanctions personally... to my knowledge, Exxon never directly lobbied against sanctions.

ruling_headline: Viral post exaggerates GOP senators' bill on embassy move
statement: "The same 3 senators who have spent the last 3 years s------- themselves over ‘Benghazi!’ just introduced a bill to reduce embassy security by 50 percent."

ruling_headline: Trump wrong that Americans don't care about his tax returns
statement: Americans don't "care at all" about Donald Trump's tax returns.

statement_context: a press conference at Trump Tower
ruling_headline: Trump says Russians were unable to hack the Republican National Committee
statement: The Russians "tried to hack the Republican National Committee, and they were unable to break through."

statement_context: Sessions' Senate confirmation hearing for attorney general
ruling_headline: Jeff Sessions objected to immigrants in armed forces, Senator Durbin says
statement: Of Sen. Jeff Sessions, "you've objected to immigrants volunteering to serve in our armed forces, saying, 'In terms of who's going to be most likely to be a spy, somebody from Cullman, Ala., or somebody from Kenya?'"

ruling_headline: Mitch McConnell says 8 out of 10 favor changing Obamacare significantly or replacing it altogether
statement: "About 8 out of 10 favor changing Obamacare significantly or replacing it altogether."

ruling_headline: Schumer: Trump and his HHS pick Tom Price at odds on Medicare
statement: Says Donald Trump campaigned on not cutting Medicare and Social Security, but his nominee for the Secretary of Health and Human Services, Tom Price, "made his career on cutting Medicare and Medicaid."

statement_context: comments to reporters on Capitol Hill
ruling_headline: Mike Pence says under Obamacare, 'American families have seen an increase in premiums of $5,000'
statement: Under Obamacare, "American families have seen an increase in premiums of $5,000."

statement_context: a statement released by the transition office
ruling_headline: Donald Trump's dubious claim that foreign governments had 'absolutely no effect' on election outcome
statement: Activities by foreign governments had "absolutely no effect on the outcome of this election."

ruling_headline: Cory Booker: McConnell wanted full ethics review of Obama nominees before hearings
statement: "In 2009, Mitch McConnell was the person that’s saying, 'Hey, we should get all the ethics information in before we do the hearings.' "

ruling_headline: Mostly True: Trump tweet about GM Chevy Cruze manufacturing
statement: "General Motors is sending Mexican made model of Chevy Cruze to U.S. car dealers-tax free across border."

ruling_headline: It's True: WikiLeaks dumped Podesta emails hour after Trump video surfaced
statement: "On Oct. 7, the Access Hollywood tape comes out. One hour later, WikiLeaks starts dropping my emails."

ruling_headline: Pants on Fire! Trump tweet about White House, Russian hacking probe
statement: "If Russia, or some other entity, was hacking, why did the White House wait so long to act? Why did they only complain after Hillary lost?"

ruling_headline: Did Rex Tillerson, oil CEO and secretary of state pick, sue to keep fracking out of own backyard?
statement: Says Rex Tillerson "sued to keep a fracking project out of his backyard."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump's Electoral College victory was not a 'massive landslide'
statement: "We had a massive landslide victory, as you know, in the Electoral College."

ruling_headline: Reince Priebus falsely claims no conclusive report whether Russia tried to influence election
statement: "There's been no conclusive or specific report to say" Russia was trying to muddy the election.

ruling_headline: Fact-checking Donald Trump's tweet on Air Force One, Boeing
statement: "Boeing is building a brand new 747 Air Force One for future presidents, but costs are out of control, more than $4 billion. Cancel order!"

statement_context: an interview on NBC's "Meet the Press"
ruling_headline: Mike Pence says Donald Trump won most counties by a Republican since Ronald Reagan
statement: Says Donald Trump "won more counties than any candidate on our side since Ronald Reagan."

ruling_headline: New York City mayor says president can't defund sanctuary cities 'across the board'
statement: On Donald Trump’s plan to cut federal funding to sanctuary cities, "because of a decision by the Supreme Court, no president's in a position to cut off funding across the board. It has to be very specific to the matter at hand."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump's Pants on Fire claim that millions of illegal votes cost him popular vote victory
statement: Says he "won the popular vote if you deduct the millions of people who voted illegally."

statement_context: an interview on The Kelly File
ruling_headline: Santa Fe mayor defends sanctuary cities, says studies don't show increase in crime
statement: "Study after study have shown that sanctuary cities do not lead to an increase in crime because of the presence of people that are undocumented."

ruling_headline: Reince Priebus says Trump, Congress have similar immigration policies
statement: "President-elect Trump's immigration policies are very similar to policies that are sitting right in the Senate and the House today to temporarily suspend immigration from countries that harbor terrorism, to temporarily suspend immigration from Syria until we get better vetting."

ruling_headline: Rand Paul says John Bolton still thinks Iraq War was right decision
statement: Says John Bolton supported the Iraq War and said last year that "I still think the decision to overthrow Saddam was correct."

ruling_headline: No, someone wasn't paid $3,500 to protest Donald Trump; it's fake news
statement: "Donald Trump Protester Speaks Out: 'I Was Paid $3,500 To Protest Trump's Rally.' "

ruling_headline: Giuliani: President Trump will be exempt from conflict-of-interest laws
statement: Financial conflict-of-interest "laws don't apply to the president, right? So, the president doesn't have to have a blind trust."

ruling_headline: Trump misleads in number of criminal immigrants illegally in country
statement: Says there are "probably 2 million, it could be even 3 million" criminal immigrants in the country illegally.

ruling_headline: Donald Trump says New York Times apologized for 'bad coverage' of him
statement: "The @nytimes sent a letter to their subscribers apologizing for their BAD coverage of me."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump wrongly tweets that he 'never said' more countries should have nuclear weapons
statement: "The @nytimes states today that DJT believes ‘more countries should acquire nuclear weapons.’ How dishonest are they. I never said this!"

ruling_headline: No, Donald Trump is not beating Hillary Clinton in the popular vote
statement: "Final election 2016 numbers: Trump won" the popular vote.

ruling_headline: No evidence to support rumors of 'We hate Muslims' chant at Trump victory rally
statement: Says "thousands" at a Manhattan rally for Donald Trump were chanting "We hate Muslims, we hate blacks, we want our great country back."

ruling_headline: In closing argument, Donald Trump wrongly says he outdraws Beyonce, Jay Z
statement: "Beyonce and Jay Z, I like them, I like them ... I get bigger crowds than they do. It's true. I get far bigger crowds."

ruling_headline: Obama says Republicans tried to 'purge' black Democrats from voter rolls in North Carolina
statement: The list of voters that North Carolina Republicans "tried to purge was two-thirds black and Democratic."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump correct that 1 in 4 working-age Americans not employed
statement: "Nearly one in four people in their prime working years are not working."

ruling_headline: Tim Kaine is right, Spanish was first European language spoken in United States
statement: "Spanish was the first European language spoken in this country."

ruling_headline: Would 51% of single parents see taxes rise under Donald Trump's tax plan?
statement: Under Donald Trump's tax plan, "51 percent of single parents would see their taxes go up."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump's Pants on Fire claim that Obama 'screamed' at protester
statement: Says that at a campaign rally President Barack Obama "spent so much time screaming at a protester, and frankly it was a disgrace."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton: Donald Trump says 'organized crime runs wild on reservations'
statement: Says Donald Trump "says organized crime runs wild on reservations."

ruling_headline: Trump wrongly claims tremendous support from women
statement: "I have tremendous support from women."

ruling_headline: Evidence ridiculously thin for sensational claim of huge underground Clinton sex network
statement: "FBI confirms evidence of huge underground Clinton sex network."

ruling_headline: Trump says the media doesn't show his crowds at rallies. He's wrong
statement: The media "never show crowds."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says Donald Trump 'wants to undo marriage equality'
statement: Says Donald Trump "wants to undo marriage equality."

statement_context: a campaign rally in Springfield, Ohio
ruling_headline: Trump leaves out context in claim about immigrants and crime
statement: "Thousands of Americans have been killed by illegal immigrants."

ruling_headline: Is Mike Pence right that 1 in 5 U.S. households don't have anyone working?
statement: "One in five American households have nobody under the same roof that's got a job."

statement_context: a campaign rally in Dade City, Fla.
ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says Donald Trump doesn't believe in equal pay
statement: Says Donald Trump "doesn't believe in equal pay."

ruling_headline: On average, Donald Trump comparison of health care, housing doesn't match data
statement: "In many instances, (people's) health care costs are more than their mortgage costs or their rent, which, by the way, is a first in American history."

ruling_headline: Trump says Twitter, Google, Facebook buried Clinton emails story
statement: "Twitter, Google and Facebook are burying the FBI criminal investigation of Clinton. Very dishonest media!"

ruling_headline: Trump said he would require schools to allow guns, Clinton says
statement: Says of Donald Trump, "He even said, on his very first day in office, he would require every school in America to let people carry guns into our classrooms."

ruling_headline: Fact-checking Donald Trump on FBI probe into Clinton emails
statement: "The FBI has reopened its investigation into Hillary Clinton ... and discovered another 650,000 emails."

ruling_headline: Pro-Clinton Super PAC says Trump wants to deport millions, including 'Dreamers'
statement: Says Donald Trump wants to deport "our Dreamers."

ruling_headline: Trump's claim about weak economic growth under President Obama doesn't tell the full story
statement: Says Barack Obama "is the first president in modern history not to have a single year of 3 percent growth."

ruling_headline: Claim that George Soros owns U.S. voting machines is Pants on Fire!
statement: "One of George Soros' companies has provided some of the (voting) machines" for some states.

ruling_headline: Pants on Fire! Trump says Clinton would let 650 million people into the U.S., in one week
statement: Says Hillary Clinton "wants to let people just pour in. You could have 650 million people pour in and we do nothing about it. Think of it. That’s what could happen. You triple the size of our country in one week."

ruling_headline: Clinton campaign says Comey letter violates Justice Department protocols
statement: "There are Justice Department policies against" FBI Director James Comey discussing details of a federal investigation "so close to an election."

ruling_headline: Clinton wrongly says FBI director sent letter about emails 'only' to Republicans
statement: Says FBI Director James Comey’s letter about new developments in the investigation into her emails "only" went "to Republican members of the House."

statement_context: a get-out-the-vote rally in North Carolina
ruling_headline: Clinton says kids are healthier
statement: "We are seeing kids who are healthier."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump says half of young black children are in 'abject poverty'
statement: "Nearly half of African-American children under the age of 6 are living in abject poverty."

ruling_headline: Clinton: Undocumented workers pay more than Trump in federal income taxes
statement: "One-half of undocumented workers pay federal income taxes, which means they are paying more federal income taxes than Donald Trump pays."

statement_context: an interview with Fox News' Megyn Kelly
ruling_headline: Newt Gingrich misleading in saying Bill Clinton paid $850,000 'penalty'
statement: In the Paula Jones case, Bill Clinton paid an "$850,000 penalty."

ruling_headline: Did U.S. spend $6 trillion in Middle East wars?
statement: "We’ve spent $6 trillion" on the wars in the Middle East.

ruling_headline: Facts dispute Donald Trump's claim that donation to FBI spouse linked to Clinton email decision
statement: "The man who was in charge of the investigation of Hillary Clinton accepted essentially from Hillary Clinton $675,000 that went to his wife."

ruling_headline: Clinton said Trump wants to know about allies' payments before defending them
statement: Says Donald Trump "was asked if he would defend our allies. He said well, first he'd want to know if they made any payments to us to defend them."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump absurdly claims Clinton campaign chairman rigged the polls. Pants on Fire!
statement: "Wikileaks also shows how John Podesta rigged the polls by oversampling Democrats, a voter suppression technique."

ruling_headline: Is Trump the first-ever candidate not to say he'll accept election results?
statement: Says Donald Trump is "the first person running for president, Republican or Democrat, who refused to say that he would respect the results of this election."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton exaggerates by saying Donald Trump plans to deport 16 million people
statement: "Donald Trump says he'd deport 16 million people."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump wrongly says 14 percent of noncitizens are registered to vote
statement: "14 percent of noncitizens are registered to vote."

ruling_headline: Half True: Clinton says she sponsored 400 bills, worked with GOP
statement: "400 bills have my name on them either as a sponsor or a co-sponsor. You don’t get that done unless you work with folks on the other side."

statement_context: a speech at the Alfred E. Smith Memorial Dinner
ruling_headline: Clinton: School boards' anti-Catholic scare tactics in 1928 election
statement: In 1928 "school boards sent home letters with children saying that if Al Smith is elected president, you will not be allowed to have or read a Bible."

ruling_headline: Context is crucial in defining how many countries now harbor ISIS
statement: "ISIS is in 32 countries."

ruling_headline: Do Clinton donors 'throw gays off of buildings'? No, that's ISIS
statement: Says Hillary Clinton takes "tens of millions of dollars from countries that hate women, that disrespect women, that throw gays off of buildings."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump says Ford is moving all small-car production to Mexico
statement: "Ford is moving all of their small-car production to Mexico."

ruling_headline: Trump right on Obama's deportation numbers, wrong about nobody talking about it
statement: "Nobody knows about it, nobody talks about it, but under Obama, millions of people have been moved out of this country, they've been deported."

ruling_headline: Trump says Russia has added nuclear warheads, while US hasn't
statement: Russia has "tremendous numbers of nuclear warheads — 1,800, by the way — where they expanded, and we didn't."

ruling_headline: What Hillary Clinton's plans mean for the U.S. debt
statement: "What I have put forward does not add a penny to the debt."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump says reports of sexual assault by him have been disproven
statement: The stories from women saying he groped or forced himself on them "largely have been debunked."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says Donald Trump claimed the Emmys were rigged
statement: "There was even a time when (Donald Trump) didn't get an Emmy for his TV program three years in a row and he started tweeting that the Emmys were rigged."

statement_context: the third presidential debate in Las Vegas
ruling_headline: Donald Trump says Hillary Clinton is 'wrong' to say he mocked a disabled reporter
statement: Says Hillary Clinton is "wrong" to say he mocked a disabled reporter.

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton: Donald Trump still promising to deport every undocumented person
statement: Says Donald Trump "said as recently as a few weeks ago in Phoenix that every undocumented person would be subject to deportation."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton correctly claims that Trump Tower was in part built by undocumented workers
statement: Says Donald Trump "used undocumented labor to build the Trump Tower."

ruling_headline: Trump wrongly says $6 billion went missing at State Department under Clinton
statement: When Hillary Clinton "ran the State Department, $6 billion was missing. How do you miss $6 billion? You ran the State Department, $6 billion was either stolen — they don't know."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump says Hillary Clinton fought for a wall between U.S., Mexico
statement: Says Hillary Clinton "wanted the wall."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump off-base in saying Hillary Clinton will 'double your taxes'
statement: Says Hillary Clinton's "plan is going to raise taxes and even double your taxes."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton blames high-up Russians for WikiLeaks releases
statement: "We have 17 intelligence agencies, civilian and military, who have all concluded that these espionage attacks, these cyberattacks, come from the highest levels of the Kremlin, and they are designed to influence our election."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump says Hillary Clinton wants to have open borders
statement: Says Hillary Clinton "wants to have open borders."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says Supreme Court gun decision dealt with protecting toddlers
statement: "What the District of Columbia was trying to do (with its handgun ban) was to protect toddlers from guns."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says 33,000 Americans die each year from guns
statement: "We have 33,000 people a year who die from guns."

ruling_headline: Trump says heroin pours across the southern border
statement: "Heroin .. pours across our southern borders."

statement_context: an interview on NBC's "Meet the Press"
ruling_headline: Mike Pence wrong on Haiti contracts steered to Clinton friends
statement: "State Department officials actually directed contracts for the Haitian recovery after the earthquake to friends of the Clintons."

ruling_headline: Clinton twists Trump's words on rescuing the auto industry during recession
statement: "Back in the Great Recession, when millions of  jobs across America hung in the balance, Donald Trump said rescuing the auto industry didn’t really matter very much. He said, and I quote again, ‘Let it go.’ "

ruling_headline: Trump off-base on Buffett, Soros deductions
statement: "Many of (Hillary Clinton's) friends took bigger deductions (than me). Warren Buffett took a massive deduction. (George) Soros, who is a friend of hers, took a massive deduction."

ruling_headline: Clinton correct Buffett claimed to pay a lower tax rate than his secretary
statement: Says Warren Buffett has publicly said his secretary "should not be paying a higher tax rate" than him.

ruling_headline: FBI director James Comey says Donald Trump has it flipped; Petraeus case was worse than Clinton's
statement: Says Hillary Clinton was "let off the hook" for her email scandal while Gen. David Petraeus had his life "destroyed for doing far, far less."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump's Pants on Fire claim of 'large scale voter fraud'
statement: "Of course, there is large scale voter fraud happening on and before election day."

statement_context: a speech in West Palm Beach, Fla.
ruling_headline: Trump says workers making less, working harder than 20 years ago
statement: "Workers in the United States are making less than they were almost 20 years ago, and yet they are working harder."

ruling_headline: Pence wrongly says more than half of Hillary Clinton's meetings went to foundation donors
statement: "We know that more than half of Hillary Clinton's meetings while she was secretary of state were given to major contributors to the Clinton Foundation."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump wrongly maligns U.S. chess prowess
statement: "We don't have any" chess grandmasters in the United States.

ruling_headline: Donald Trump wildly exaggerates Amb. Christopher Steven's requests for extra Benghazi security
statement: Says Libya "Ambassador (Christopher) Stevens sent 600 requests for help" in Benghazi.

ruling_headline: Clinton says Muslims have been in America since George Washington
statement: "We've had Muslims in America since George Washington."

ruling_headline: Obama says terrorism worldwide has not increased substantially since he took office
statement: "If you look worldwide, the number of terrorist incidents have not substantially increased."

ruling_headline: Trump: 'I’ve been proven right' about Clinton wanting open borders
statement: Says "I’ve been proven right" about "Hillary Clinton's radical call for open borders, meaning anyone in the world can enter the United States without any limit at all."

ruling_headline: Clinton is right: Trump tax plan gives more to rich than Bush tax cuts
statement: Says Donald Trump’s tax plan gives the wealthy and corporations "more than the Bush tax cuts by at least a factor of two."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton claim that US is energy independent goes too far
statement: "We are now, for the first time ever, energy independent."

statement_context: the second presidential debate in St. Louis
ruling_headline: Donald Trump off-base in claim about Michelle Obama ad against Hillary Clinton
statement: "I've gotten to see the commercials that they did on you. And I've gotten to see some of the most vicious commercials I've ever seen of Michelle Obama talking about you, Hillary."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump incorrectly pins Benghazi criticism on Sidney Blumenthal
statement: Says Sidney Blumenthal wrote that the Benghazi attack was "almost certainly preventable. Clinton was in charge of the State Department, and it failed to protect U.S. personnel and an American consulate in Libya."

ruling_headline: Trump mangles facts on Clinton and Haiti jobs project
statement: Says "Hillary Clinton set aside environmental and labor rules to help a South Korean company with a record of violating workers’ rights set up what amounts to a sweatshop in Haiti."

ruling_headline: Trump says Clinton viciously attacked those who charged abuse by Bill
statement: Says Hillary Clinton "viciously" attacked women abused by Bill Clinton.

ruling_headline: Clinton says she was gone for the 'red line' in Syria incident
statement: "I was gone" when there was a red line against Syria.

ruling_headline: Donald Trump says ICE endorsed him
statement: "ICE just endorsed me."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump largely accurate that U.S. had biggest increase in murders in 45 years
statement: "We have an increase in murder within our cities, the biggest in 45 years."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump wrongly says Hillary Clinton laughed at a 12-year-old rape victim
statement: Says after Hillary Clinton helped a man accused of raping a 12-year-old, "she's seen laughing on two separate occasions, laughing at the girl who was raped."

ruling_headline: Clinton said terrorists use Trump's remarks about Muslims for recruitment
statement: "You can look at the propaganda on a lot of the terrorists' sites and what Donald Trump says about Muslims is used to recruit fighters."

ruling_headline: Trump's Pants on Fire about his early-morning tweet on Alicia Machado
statement: Says a tweet he sent out "wasn’t saying, ‘check out a sex tape.’ It was just ‘take a look at" the background of Alicia Machado.

ruling_headline: Trump: Clinton won't use the term 'radical Islamic terrorists'
statement: "These are radical Islamic terrorists, and (Hillary Clinton) won't even mention the word."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump wrongly says Hillary Clinton 'wants to go to a single-payer plan' for health care
statement: Says Hillary Clinton "wants to go to a single-payer plan" for health care

ruling_headline: Donald Trump says Hillary Clinton deleted 33,000 emails after getting a subpoena
statement: "You (Hillary Clinton) get a subpoena, and after getting the subpoena you delete 33,000 emails."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says a record 90% of Americans have health insurance today
statement: "Right now we are at 90 percent health insurance covered. That's the highest we've ever been in our country."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump has no 'fiduciary responsibility' on his personal tax returns, experts say
statement: Says he has "a fiduciary responsibility to his business, his family and his employees to pay no more tax than legally required."

ruling_headline: Tim Kaine said Trump ticket wants to deport 16 million, end birthright citizenship
statement: Says "Donald Trump proposes to deport 16 million people, 11 million who are here without documents, and both Donald Trump and Mike Pence want to get rid of birthright citizenship."

ruling_headline: Trump: Clinton promised to add 200K jobs to upstate New York, but 'they lost so many jobs'
statement: Says Hillary Clinton "promised, running for the Senate years ago, 200,000 jobs for upstate New York. ... Not only didn't they come, but they lost so many jobs."

ruling_headline: Limited data support Gina Raimondo's claim that motorists save when illegal immigrants get licenses
statement: "In other states (where illegal immigrants have been allowed to get driver's licenses) their insurance premiums for everybody have gone down."

statement_context: the vice presidential debate in Farmville, Va.
ruling_headline: Tim Kaine overstates Clinton's record on cutting Russia's nuclear stockpile
statement: Says Hillary Clinton "went toe-to-toe with Russia as secretary of state to do the New START agreement to reduce Russia's nuclear stockpile."

ruling_headline: Pence's False claim that Trump 'hasn't broken' tax return promise
statement: Says Donald Trump "hasn’t broken his promise" to release his tax returns.

statement_context: the vice presidential debate in Farmville, Va.
ruling_headline: Mike Pence tidies up Donald Trump's quote about Mexicans as 'good people'
statement: Says Donald Trump, in his campaign announcement speech, "also said, ‘And many of them (Mexicans) are good people. You keep leaving that out of your quote."

statement_context: the vice presidential debate in Farmville, Va.
ruling_headline: Tim Kaine recalls Mike Pence comment on Vladimir Putin
statement: "Gov. Pence said, inarguably, Vladimir Putin is a better leader than President Obama."

ruling_headline: Kaine: Police stopped slain Minnesota driver over 40 times
statement: Says Philando Castile "had been stopped by police 40 or 50 times before that fatal incident."

ruling_headline: At debate, Mike Pence claims Trump never said more nations should have nuclear weapons
statement: Says Donald Trump "never said that" more nations should get nuclear weapons.

ruling_headline: Mike Pence says Hillary Clinton wants to turn Obamacare into single-payer
statement: Says Hillary Clinton and Tim Kaine "want to expand (Obamacare) into a single-payer program."

ruling_headline: Tim Kaine Mostly False on Donald Trump's Social Security stance
statement: Donald Trump would "engage in a risky scheme to privatize Social Security."

statement_context: a vice presidential debate in Virginia
ruling_headline: Kaine: Trump said undocumented immigrants 'will all be gone'
statement: "When Donald Trump spoke in Phoenix, he looked the audience in the eye and he said ‘no, we're building a wall and we're deporting everybody.’ He said, quote, ‘they will all be gone. They will all be gone.’ This is one of the ones where you can go to the tape on it and see what Donald Trump has said."

ruling_headline: Pence repeats false claim on Clinton Foundation's limited charitable work
statement: "10 cents on the dollar from the Clinton Foundation goes to charitable causes."

ruling_headline: Tim Kaine says that during the Obama administration 15 million jobs were created
statement: Says that during President Barack Obama’s tenure, the United States has created "15 million new jobs."

ruling_headline: Mike Pence: Hillary Clinton failed to keep U.S. troops in Iraq
statement: Says "Iraq has been overrun by ISIS because Hillary Clinton failed to renegotiate . . . a status of forces agreement."

ruling_headline: Mike Pence leaves out some details on his tax cut
statement: "In the state of Indiana, I’ve signed more than $3.5 billion in tax relief."

ruling_headline: Tim Kaine says Donald Trump, Mike Pence want to eliminate the federal minimum wage
statement: "First, Donald Trump said wages are too high, and both Donald Trump and Mike Pence think we ought to eliminate the federal minimum wage."

statement_context: the first presidential debate at Hofstra University
ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton's off-base linkage of tax cuts and the Great Recession
statement: The Great Recession emerged "in large part because of tax policies that slashed taxes on the wealthy, failed to invest in the middle class, took their eyes off of Wall Street, and created a perfect storm."

ruling_headline: Barack Obama says VA budget has risen 85 percent on his watch
statement: "Since I came into office … we have increased the VA budget by 85 percent."

ruling_headline: Partial credit: Chelsea Clinton says Gary Johnson wants to eliminate public schools
statement: Says "Gary Johnson and the Libertarian Party want to get rid of the public school system."

statement_context: a presidential debate at Hofstra University
ruling_headline: Trump says 1,800 people who were going to be deported ended up becoming citizens
statement: "These people that we were going to deport for good reason ended up becoming citizens. Ended up becoming citizens. And it was 800. And now it turns out it might be 1,800, and they don't even know."

ruling_headline: Claims that Hillary Clinton wore earpiece at debate don't hold up
statement: Say photographs of Hillary Clinton at the debate show what could be an earpiece.

statement_context: the presidential debate in Hempstead, N.Y.
ruling_headline: Donald Trump and Lester Holt clash over whether stop-and-frisk is constitutional in New York
statement: Says "no, you’re wrong," responding to the assertion that stop-and-frisk was ruled unconstitutional in New York.

ruling_headline: Donald Trump: My Trans-Pacific Partnership opposition made Hillary Clinton change her stance
statement: Says to Hillary Clinton, "You heard what I said about (the Trans-Pacific Partnership trade deal), and all of a sudden you were against it."

statement_context: a presidential debate at Hofstra University
ruling_headline: Donald Trump wrong again about NATO increasing terrorism efforts 'largely' because of him
statement: "NATO is opening up a major terror division. ... I'm sure I'm not going to get credit for it, but that was largely because of what I was saying and my criticism of NATO."

ruling_headline: Trump says Clinton would bring in 620,000 refugees in her first term
statement: Says "Hillary Clinton's plan would bring in 620,000 refugees in her first term, alone, with no effective way to screen or vet them. Her plan would cost $400 billion in terms of lifetime welfare and entitlement costs."

statement_context: a presidential debate at Hofstra University
ruling_headline: Donald Trump off-base in saying murders are up in New York City
statement: In New York City, "murders are up."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump's false claim that Clinton's energy plan will cost the economy $5 trillion
statement: Says Hillary Clinton’s energy agenda "will cost the U.S. economy over $5 trillion"

ruling_headline: Trump falsely tries to pin birtherism on Clinton insiders
statement: Says top Clinton advisers "were pressing" birther movement stories "very hard."

ruling_headline: At debate, Hillary Clinton tax claim ignores years when Donald Trump reportedly paid federal taxes
statement: "The only years that anybody's ever seen" of Donald Trump’s tax returns "showed he didn't pay any federal income tax."

ruling_headline: True: Hillary Clinton says federal government sued Donald Trump for housing discrimination
statement: Says Donald Trump "started his career back in 1973 being sued by the Justice Department for racial discrimination because he would not rent apartments in one of his developments to African-Americans."

statement_context: a Presidential debate at Hofstra University
ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton correctly cites outside analyses of Trump's tax plan
statement: According to "independent experts," Donald Trump's tax plan "would blow up the debt by over $5 trillion and would in some instances disadvantage middle-class families compared to the wealthy."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump says Chicago has experienced thousands of shootings this year
statement: "In Chicago, they've had thousands of shootings, thousands since Jan. 1. Thousands of shootings."

ruling_headline: At first debate, Donald Trump claims, again, that he was against war in Iraq
statement: "I did not support the war in Iraq … The record shows that I’m right."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton claims Donald Trump invited Russian President Vladimir Putin  to hack Americans
statement: Says Donald Trump "publicly invited Putin to hack into Americans’ (emails)."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump says Hillary Clinton lauded controversial Trans-Pacific trade deal
statement: Says Hillary Clinton called the Trans-Pacific Partnership "the gold standard. You called it the gold standard of trade deals. You said it’s the finest deal you’ve ever seen."

statement_context: a Presidential debate at Hofstra University
ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton correct that gun deaths for young black males outpace next 9 causes combined
statement: "The gun epidemic is the leading cause of death of young African-American men, more than the next nine causes put together."

statement_context: a Presidential debate at Hofstra University
ruling_headline: Donald Trump wrong that 'you will learn more' from financial disclosure form than from tax returns
statement: "You will learn more about Donald Trump by going down to the Federal Elections" to see the financial disclosure form than by looking at tax returns.

ruling_headline: At New York debate, Donald Trump denies saying climate change is a Chinese hoax
statement: "I did not — I did not — I do not say that. I do not say that" climate change is a hoax perpetrated by the Chinese.

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says Donald Trump has said he would negotiate down the national debt
statement: Says Donald Trump once suggested that he "would try to negotiate down the national debt."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says Donald Trump rooted for the housing crisis
statement: Says Donald Trump "was one of the people who rooted for the housing crisis. He said back in 2006, ‘Gee, I hope it does collapse because then I can go in and buy some and make some money.’ "

ruling_headline: Donald Trump wrong to say Hillary Clinton wants to shut down natural gas, fracking
statement: Says Hillary Clinton and Tim Kaine "want to shut down shale, and shut down natural gas."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump claim on Israeli profiling misses broader security context
statement: Says Israel profiles based on ethnicity and "does it very successfully."

statement_context: an open letter to Donald Trump
ruling_headline: Experts say Donald Trump's 'policies' dovetail with what Vladimir Putin would like for Russia
statement: Says Donald Trump has outlined "policies that read like a Kremlin wish list."

ruling_headline: Trump's Pants on Fire claim that black communities 'are absolutely in the worst shape' ever
statement: "Our African-American communities are absolutely in the worst shape they've ever been in before. Ever. Ever. Ever."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton overstates impact of New START on Russia's nuclear arsenal
statement: Says New START, passed while Clinton was secretary of state, is a "treaty cutting Russia’s nuclear arms."

statement_context: an interview with Fox News' Bill O'Reilly
ruling_headline: Donald Trump says he never called for profiling Muslims
statement: "I never said" that Muslims would be subject to profiling under his policies.

statement_context: a speech at the Congressional Hispanic Caucus Institute
ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says immigration reform will add $700 billion to U.S. economy
statement: Says comprehensive immigration reform "will add $700 billion to our economy."

ruling_headline: RNC makes weak case that 'over the past eight years, black youth unemployment is up'
statement: "Over the past eight years, black youth unemployment is up."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton correct; Hispanic wealth disproportionately lower than its share of the population
statement: "Latinos are 17 percent of our country's population but hold only 2 percent of its wealth."

ruling_headline: Trump says in few years, immigrant share of population will break records
statement: "Within just a few years, immigration as a share of national population is set to break all historical records."

ruling_headline: Tim Kaine says millennials agree with Clinton, not Trump, on big issues
statement: Says Hillary Clinton and millennials have the same positions on climate change, abortion rights, immigration reform, gay rights and college affordability. "Donald Trump doesn't."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump's Pants on Fire claim that he 'finished' the Obama birther talk
statement: "I finished" the controversy about where President Barack Obama was born.

ruling_headline: Fact-checking Donald Trump's claim Hillary Clinton started Obama birther movement
statement: "Hillary Clinton and her campaign of 2008 started the birther controversy."

ruling_headline: Full Flop: Donald Trump abandons Barack Obama birther conspiracy
statement: On whether Barack Obama was born in the United States.

ruling_headline: John Fleming attacks IRS in inaccurate radio ad
statement: "The head of the IRS ordered 24,000 emails erased before Congress could review them, making sure the American people will never know the real truth."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump's Pants on Fire claim that Hillary Clinton 'has no child care plan'
statement: "My opponent has no child care plan."

ruling_headline: No, Donald Trump's foundation money does not come from him
statement: Says the Donald J.Trump Foundation's money "is his money."

statement_context: a Hillary for America television ad
ruling_headline: Clinton ad: Trump Management was charged with discriminating against black people
statement: "Trump Management was charged with discriminating against African-Americans and breaking federal law."

ruling_headline: Comparing the medical histories of Clinton, Trump, Romney and Obama
statement: "You've got a medical report on me that meets the same standard as Mitt Romney and Barack Obama."

ruling_headline: Trump says 1 million legal crossings along U.S.-Mexico border
statement: Says U.S.-Mexico border has "1 million legal border crossings each and every day."

ruling_headline: That Hillary Clinton 'undercover nurse' story is bogus
statement: Says Hillary Clinton had an "undercover nurse" with her at the Sept. 11 memorial ceremony in New York.

ruling_headline: Barack Obama says Trump foundation took other people's money, bought a six-foot-tall painting
statement: Says Donald Trump's foundation "took money other people gave to his charity and then bought a six-foot-tall painting of himself."

statement_context: an interview on NBC's "Meet the Press"
ruling_headline: Wolfowitz wrongly says Germany, France thought Iraq had WMD
statement: "The Germans, the French, countries that opposed us in the (Iraq) war, all believed (Saddam Hussein) had weapons of mass destruction."

ruling_headline: Trump is right: Heroin is coming in through southern border
statement: Heroin comes in the United States "from the southern border."

statement_context: an Ask Me Anything session on reddit
ruling_headline: William Weld says 76% of Americans want Gary Johnson in debates
statement: Says "76 percent of all voters in the United States say they want Johnson-Weld, by name, in the presidential debates."

statement_context: an interview on Meet the Press
ruling_headline: Mike Pence says 'no effort' made against visa overstays
statement: For immigrants with visa overstays, "we make no effort to hold them accountable to that or uphold the law."

ruling_headline: Bloggers hype Hillary Clinton health poll as a representative survey of all doctors; it's not
statement: Say "71 percent of doctors say Hillary's health concerns are 'serious' and 'could be disqualifying.' "

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton wrongly says it's 'legal' to fire employees for discussing pay 'in most places'
statement: "That's legal: If you find out about somebody else's salary even if you're doing exactly the same job, you can be retaliated against, including being fired, in most places."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump's False claim veterans treated worse than illegal immigrants
statement: "Our veterans, in many cases, are being treated worse than illegal immigrants."

ruling_headline: Facts take a vacation in Occupy Democrats' post about presidential, congressional time off
statement: Says President Barack Obama "has taken less vacation days than any other president in a generation," while Congress "has taken more vacation days than any other Congress in history."

ruling_headline: Did Vladimir Putin call Trump 'brilliant'?
statement: Says Russian President Vladimir Putin "calls me brilliant."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says Trump supported intervention in Libya
statement: Says Donald Trump is "on record extensively supporting (the) intervention in Libya."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says none of her emails had classification headers
statement: "Classified material has a header which says ‘top-secret, secret, confidential.’ Nothing, and I will repeat this and this is verified in the report by the Department of Justice, none of the emails sent or received by me had such a header."

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton says Donald Trump supports privatizing the VA health care system
statement: Says Donald Trump supports "an agenda out there" to privatize the Veterans Affairs health care system.

ruling_headline: Did Hillary Clinton say she was "satisfied" with Veterans Administration?
statement: Says Hillary Clinton said the Veterans Affairs scandal is "over-exaggerated." "She said she was satisfied with what was going on."

ruling_headline: Trump repeats wrong claim that he opposed Iraq War
statement: "I was totally against the war in Iraq."

statement_context: an interview on CNN's "State of the Union"
ruling_headline: Rudy Giuliani says food stamps rose two and a half times under Barack Obama
statement: "Food stamps have gone up two-and-a-half times under Barack Obama."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump says his financial disclosures more than make up for lack of releasing tax returns
statement: "I released the most extensive financial review of anybody in the history of politics. … You don't learn much in a tax return."

ruling_headline: Trump says Secure Communities, 287(g) immigration programs worked
statement: The Secure Communities Program and 287(g) immigration programs "were programs that worked" but were "recklessly gutted" by the Obama administration.

ruling_headline: Pence wrongly says Trump has been consistent in immigration views
statement: "Donald Trump’s been completely consistent" about his plan for nonviolent undocumented immigrants.

ruling_headline: Mike Pence cites Clinton support for more Syrian refugees
statement: Says Hillary Clinton "wants to increase Syrian refugees to this country by 550 percent."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump strays from key facts on Hillary Clinton 'amnesty,' social programs for immigrants
statement: Says "Hillary Clinton has pledged amnesty in her first 100 days, and her plan will provide Obamacare, Social Security, and Medicare for illegal immigrants, breaking the federal budget."

statement_context: a speech on immigration in Phoenix
ruling_headline: Donald Trump says Obama has let 300,000 criminal aliens to go back into U.S. communities
statement: "Since 2013 alone, the Obama administration has allowed 300,000 criminal aliens to return back into United States communities. These are individuals encountered or identified by (Immigration and Customs Enforcement), but who were not detained or processed for deportation because it wouldn't have been politically correct."

ruling_headline: Mostly True: Donald Trump says 23 countries refuse to take back their natives from America
statement: "There are at least 23 countries that refuse to take their people back after they’ve been ordered to leave the United States, including large numbers of violent criminals."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump repeats Pants on Fire claim about '30 million' illegal immigrants
statement: The number of illegal immigrants "could be 3 million. It could be 30 million."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump says illegal immigration costs $113 billion a year
statement: "Illegal immigration costs our country more than $113 billion a year."

ruling_headline: Did the Clinton Foundation go 'above and beyond' in transparency?
statement: The Clinton Foundation "took steps that went above and beyond all legal requirements and, indeed, all standard requirements followed by every other charitable organization."

ruling_headline: Has Hillary Clinton not had a press conference in 269 days?
statement: "It has been 269 days since (Hillary) Clinton has held a press conference."

ruling_headline: PAC ad say Bruce Poliquin voted to force seniors to pay more for prescription drugs
statement: Says U.S. Rep. Bruce Poliquin voted to "force seniors to pay more for prescription drugs."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump is wrong that 'inner-city crime is reaching record levels'
statement: "Inner-city crime is reaching record levels."

statement_context: an interview on NBC's Meet the Press
ruling_headline: Reince Priebus says Clinton campaign and supporters started the birther movement
statement: "Her campaign and her supporters in her campaign were the ones that borne out the birther movement."

ruling_headline: Trump says they were going to build a wall in '06, but environmental rules got in the way
statement: "They were going to build the wall a while ago, not so long ago, like in '06. And they couldn't get environmental impact statements."

ruling_headline: Gary Johnson questions pollsters as he tries to join Clinton, Trump on debate stage
statement: "None of the polls being conducted right now have us on the top line. None of them. It's always Trump and Clinton and then second question, third question. ... If we were included in the top line, as Johnson/Trump/Clinton, we'd be at 20 percent."

statement_context: an interview during NBC's Meet the Press
ruling_headline: Did Hillary Clinton call African-American youth 'superpredators?'
statement: Says Hillary Clinton "is the one that labeled African-American youth as ‘superpredators.’"

ruling_headline: Hillary Clinton, citing 'Trump Effect,' says teachers are reporting more bullying in schools
statement: "Parents and teachers are already worrying about what they call the ‘Trump Effect.’ They report that bullying and harassment are on the rise in our schools, especially targeting students of color, Muslims and immigrants."

ruling_headline: Trump's False claim Hillary Clinton wants to raise taxes on African-American businesses 50 percent
statement: Says Hillary Clinton "wants to raise taxes on African-American owned businesses to as much as nearly 50 percent more than they're paying now."

statement_context: at a rally in Tampa, Fla.
ruling_headline: Donald Trump: Clinton's celebrity backers 'aren't very hot anymore'
statement: The Hollywood celebrities endorsing Hillary Clinton are "in many cases celebrities that aren’t very hot anymore."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump offers misleading statistics about Hispanic poverty
statement: "Since President Obama came into office, another 2 million Hispanics have joined the ranks of those in poverty. … The number of Hispanic children living in poverty increased by 15 percent in that short period of time."

ruling_headline: Reince Priebus' False claim that 80% of Clinton Foundation costs are overhead
statement: "The fact is" the Clinton Foundation has "got about 80 percent in overhead and 20 percent of the money is actually getting into the places it should."

ruling_headline: Donald Trump ad says illegal immigrants would be collecting Social Security under Hillary Clinton
statement: Says Hillary Clinton wants illegal immigrants "collecting Social Security benefits."

ruling_headline: Clinton surrogate spins Clinton Foundation defense
statement: Says Hillary Clinton "abided by the ethics agreement" between the Clinton Foundation and the Obama administration.

ruling_headline: Donald Trump's Mostly False claim that $400 million payment to Iran was 'ransom'
statement: The Obama administration gave Iran "$400 million in ransom payment cash."
